Comment: No. This is *mularky*. Comment: There’s a difference between a good strategy of the Right to control media, and saying that in THIS particular election, the media is to blame more so than Biden is for the Trump outcome. Biden literally made decisions that put us here in the first place. So, what I am saying is, with what his broken commitment and his hamstringing of the Harris campaigns messaging had done to their chances, at that point, yes, the media is icing to the cake. So by weight, yes icing is a minuscule layer. I don’t think pulling them back to center is the winning factor, the turnout was so abysmal, it wasn’t as if they pushed the needle towards Trump. If you still don’t get it, then I’d say find a free polisci online course and review the voter turnout data.   Trump is cracking those votes regardless, and it’s more systemic and patbalogical in this country than “big media bad” we’re talking the post-nixon education system playbook et al. Those voters are about 80% cooked. But, no you’re absolutely wrong to pretend no one running against Trump is beating him that election. That’s ignorant of the turnout data, period. And, aside from all that, Media isn’t the chief issue anyway. “Media” isn’t electing him. There was plenty of evidence out there available to people outside of “Media” that could have been weighed against a candidate that felt like a better advocate for their struggles that they had a say in.
